result.execSummary:
The defendant Amy R Braun was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Apply 52 days sentence credit, if revoked.
Concurrent with: Waukesha County Case 14CM2085 and Count 2.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to court costs - PAID IN FULL.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
ADOA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Mental health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
No violent contact with husband and son.
Case 15CM1057 is dismissed and read-in.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions, commencing forthwith.
Apply 147 days sentence credit.
Concurrent with: 14CM2085.
Concurrent with: Waukesha County Case 14CM2085 and Count 1.

miscConds.notes:
Cash bail aplied to Court costs - balance to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Same Conditions for Probation apply as to Count 1.

records.addlTxt: Probation revoked, sentence imposed.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form filed.

Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Amy R Braun in court, in custody, with attorney Daniel Mcmurray.   

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.


Court orders the following:
Count 1:
90  Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
147 Days Credit.
Concurrent to:  Case 14CM2085


Count 2:
225 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
147 Days Credit.
Concurrent to:  Case 14CM2085
Defendant can be transferred to Huber - Forthwith.


Any outstanding costs/fines/surcharges are to be converted to a civil judgment.
Letter dated April 28, 2016 filed by defendant regarding her sentencing after revocation hearing.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 9, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Amy R Braun
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 04-25-2016)
Prior: W166 N8638 Theodore Avenue, Menomonee Falls, WI 53051
with attachments filed by Department of Corrections.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.  
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form filed.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Natalie Schiferl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Amy R Braun in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney Jess Martinez by Atty. McMurray.  
Case called along with:  14CM2085 & 15CM1057

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to both counts 1 & 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of both counts 1 & 2.
Defendant's son presented a statement to the court.
Defendant's husband presented a statement to the court.



Court orders the following:
Count 1:
SENTENCE WITHHELD.
52 Days Credit - IF REVOKED.


Term of Probation:  18 Months
Concurrent to:  Waukesha County Case 14CM2085 & count 2.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No Violent contact with:  husband and son.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.


Costs:  $243
DV Surcharge:  Court Waives.
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Apply Bail.







Count 3:
SENTENCE WITHHELD.
52 Days Credit - IF REVOKED.


Term of Probation:  18 Months.
Concurrent to:  Waukesha County Case 14CM2085 & count 1.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Same as count 1.

Costs:  $243.
Apply Bail.
Balance to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME: 
45 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.
